snippet: The Costa Concordia, has been lying on its side off Giglio Island since it ran aground last year, killing 32 people.
abstract: Engineers say they have succeeded in righting the cruise ship Costa Concordia and removing it from two granite reefs where it ran aground in 2012 causing deaths of 32 people; 19-hour, highly complicated salvage operation managed to completely rotate the ship, leaning it on an underwater platform built underneath.

byline.original: By GAIA PIANIGIANI and ALAN COWELL
byline.contributor: Gaia Pianigiani reported from Giglio, and Alan Cowell from London.

lead_paragraph: The Costa Concordia, has been lying on its side off Giglio Island since it ran aground last year, killing 32 people.

headline.main: Crews Right Cruise Ship in Waters Off Italy
headline.print_headline: Crews Right Cruise Ship In Waters Off Italy
